intro: Oxygraphis chamissonis, commonly known as the Pacific coast sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It is adapted to harsh, salty environments and is often found in areas with strong coastal winds. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for stabilizing dune ecosystems.
